Description: Schist artefact in the shape of a nail, probably natural. A long segment tapers down to a pointed bottom - the latter of which is defined by a raised line, which runs all the way around. The head is of a lighter greyish colour. The body is uneven and of variable thicknesses.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2Y (a/b), under level 2 cross-wall
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 201)
